<title level="1" pfs="">[Teraphant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=996)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Though teraphants may resemble an elephant from afar, teraphants lack the long incisors that mark other pachyderms. Instead, tusk-like horns grow from their forehead. Native to Vudra, teraphants are occasionally found in Jalmeray and Nex, brought as rare gifts for nobles.

 These placid herbivores' resonant psychic powers warn them against creatures approaching with ill intent. Faced with strong, sustained emotions, teraphants may find themselves responding in kind, which sometimes drive them into a fearsome rage against aggressive foes.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Beast](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 28

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Teraphant.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 9">[Teraphant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=996)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Huge" />
<trait label="Beast" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=20" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #158: Sixty Feet Under](/Sources.aspx?ID=47) pg. 86</row>

**Perception** +18; emotion sense 120 feet, [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=23)

**Languages**
[Vudrani](/Languages.aspx?ID=45); (can't speak any language)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +20, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +18, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +18

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +7

**Dex** +1

**Con** +5

**Int** -2

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +3
</row>

**Emotion Sense** ([emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) A teraphant can sense the emotions of creatures within 120 feet as an imprecise sense. Emotion sense is a precise sense against creatures under an [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60) effect. A creature under the effects of [_calm emotions_](/Spells.aspx?ID=31) can't be noticed via emotion sense.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 27 

**Fort** +20 

**Ref** +14 

**Will** +18 

</row>

**HP** 175

**Empathetic Response** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** A creature within 60 feet of the teraphant is targeted by a spell or ability with the [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60) trait; **Effect** The teraphant also benefits from the spell or effect, as though it were an additional target for 1 minute or until the triggering spell or ability ends.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 45 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
horn +20 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d6+9 piercing

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
trunk +20 ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** grabbing trunk

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
foot +20 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d10+9 bludgeoning

**Grabbing Trunk**   A Medium or smaller creature hit by the teraphant's trunk is grabbed. If the teraphant moves, it can bring the grabbed creature along with it.

**Impale** <actions string="Two Actions" />  **Requirement** The teraphant has a creature grabbed; **Effect** The teraphant slams the creature onto one of its horns. The target must attempt a DC 27 Reflex save or suffer 3d6+9 piercing damage and 1d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) (6d6+18 piercing damage on a critical failure).

**Psychokinetic Trumpet** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The teraphant lets out a loud trumpet that deals 8d8 mental damage (DC 27 basic Will save) in a 30-foot cone. A creature that fails its save is also [pushed](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) 15 feet (30 feet on a critical failure). If a pushed creatures strikes a solid barrier, it takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage and stops. The teraphant can't use Psychokinetic Trumpet again for 1d4 rounds.

**[Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=39)** <actions string="Three Actions" />  Large or smaller, foot, DC 27

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Teraphant Hunters</title>

Few things threaten teraphants other than the Vudrani hunters known as apathets. Apathets rely on emotion-deadening alchemical elixirs and spells to get close to their prey. Some apathets sell teraphant horns to those who believe their horns are the source of these creatures' psychic powers; others serve rajahs who wish to enslave a teraphant.

</aside>
